title: NASA Associate Administrator Jim Free to Retire After 30 Years Service
summary: NASA Associate Administrator Jim Free announced Wednesday his retirement, effective Saturday, Feb. 22. As associate administrator, Free has been the senior advisor to NASA Acting Administrator Janet Petro and leads NASA’s 10 center directors, as well as the mission directorate associate administrators at NASA Headquarters in Washington. He is the agency’s chief operating officer for […]

title: In the Starlight: Portia Keyes Procures Mission-Critical Support
summary: One semester as a NASA Pathways intern was enough to inspire Portia Keyes to sign up for a Russian language class at college. title: OQ Technology gets EU funds to accelerate direct-to-smartphone efforts
summary:
OQ Technology said Feb. 19 it could receive up to €17.5 million ($18.2 million) from a European Union-backed accelerator to support efforts to connect smartphones via its small satellite constellation.

title: NASA Sends Experiment to Space to Study Antibiotic-Resistant Bacteria
summary: In an effort to learn more about astronaut health and the effects of space on the human body, NASA is conducting a new experiment aboard the International Space Station to speed up the detection of antibiotic-resistant bacteria, thus improving the health safety not only of astronauts but patients back on Earth. title: Report: Space Force strategy, resources insufficient to counter China
summary:
The Space Force, still in its infancy at five years old, must overcome systemic issues, including inadequate resources, unclear roles, and a lack of warfighting ethos, says a new report by the Mitchell Institute for Aerospace Studies

summary:

title: Glacier melt intensifying freshwater loss and accelerating sea-level rise
summary: Ice melting from glaciers around the world is depleting regional freshwater resources and driving global sea levels to rise at ever-faster rates.
